{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3137985,"name":"Berke Sinan Yetkin","username":"Just_A_Bored_Fella","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T22:59:25.422Z","cooked":"

Hi,

Having only secured 2 neo’s from F.I.R.S.T. Choice if neo and sparkmaxes don’t restock on Andymark, we won’t be able to get all the required hardware for a full neo am14u5 tank drive.

We want to experiment with the neo encoders because we mainly use mecanum drive and having 8 DIO ports just get eaten up by encoders at the start of every season seems unviable. Also, if we don’t get pathplanning and pose estimation working with neo encoders now, it will be quite annoying to figure that out next season since this is our best season yet in terms of programming knowledge. If our luck doesn’t change, only a single senior developer will remain on the team because of the inevitable reality of our country’s university admission system.

So if we were to combine a neo and a cim motor on a single toughbox mini, will we experience bad stuff? Their torque and rpm are about the same, but it seems sketchy nonetheless.

NEOs are in stock at REV

Spark Maxs have an ETA of 8th of february on REV.

You could also look into using Cancoders that wire up directly to the CAN Bus. Also, if you do CIM+Talon SRX, you could use SRX Mag Encoders wired directly to Talons.

Did you try reaching out to other Turkish teams if they have any spare NEOs?

Other people would answer the original question better though. Let us know if you have any other questions.

Hi,

We have to use the 450$ drivetrain opt-out Andymark voucher for our purchases this season, so REV stocks doesn’t help us.

CANCoders are really pricey, we are a public school and don’t want to blow our voucher for a single encoder worth 1/2 NEO+SparkMAX combos. We haven’t considered using Talons though.

Talking about borrowing NEOs, maayyybe we could start with asking XSHARC if we could borrow 2 NEOs and 2 SparkMAXes?

To directly answer your question, theoretically you can put a Neo and a CIM into the same gearbox without issue as long as you ensure they are always receiving the same power command. The Neo is more or less a drop-in replacement for a CIM so you can generally use it anywhere you would use a CIM or MiniCIM.

However, practically I would strongly advise against it. If you are planning to use a mecanum drive again and you only have 2 Neos, you will not want to use them on your drivetrain as it is important to have all four gearboxes identical in terms of motors and gear ratios. If you are planning on using a tank drive instead of mecanum, it is also not necessary to use the Neos as you will only need 2 encoders (4 DIO ports). If I had a limited number of Neos I would definitely save them for use on mechanisms and use CIMs on the drive.
